Stephen Hawking.Action: Uses a computer and assistive technology skillfully to communicate despite physical limitations.
Remains alert and observant in a formal setting, attentively watching the environment.
Engages in a reckless but playful bicycle race with his close friend Brian, showing a fun-loving and active nature.
Operates complex communication device skillfully by selecting letters and whole words to form sentences using a clicker-plate and computer monitor.
Pushes toggle-stick controller accurately to move his powered wheelchair.
Races recklessly on bicycle through narrow, winding lanes, taking calculated risks and demonstrating physical skill and confidence.
Races a friend to the party entrance, laughing and entering together.
Engages casually with his friend Brian during the party, showing light humor about the subject of love and science.
Enters the party confidently and converses wittily with Brian about his doctorate subject, showing clear awareness and quick intellectually playful response.
Crashes his bike into a hedge along with Brian upon arrival at the party, showing lack of physical coordination or care in that moment.
Engages in prolonged eye contact with Jane, showing interest, smiles despite an uncertain situation.
Focuses on Jane while declining punch from Brian, indicating sincerity and a gentle social approach.
Considers Brian's offer to be introduced to Jane with hesitation, showing a thoughtful and respectful approach to social interaction.
Applied for a Civil Service job as a backup plan, showing practical foresight and planning.
Slept in on the morning of the exam and thus perhaps missed the opportunity, indicating a lapse in punctuality or self-discipline.
Decides to slowly approach Jane after being left alone, initiating a conversation.
Engages in light, somewhat teasing banter about religion with Jane, smiling cheekily.
Uses suspicious tone when asking Jane about religion, potentially indicating slight judgment.
Decides to slowly approach Jane and initiates a conversation, confidently stating his profession as a cosmologist and engages with humor.
Uses a playful, clever explanation of cosmology as 'a kind of religion for intelligent atheists' and makes a cheeky remark about England and religion.
Smiles cheekily and grins, shares witty banter with Jane, making the conversation light and engaging.
Responds honestly and humorously about his exam results and motivations, showing openness and self-deprecation.
Explains cosmologists worship a single unifying equation that explains everything in the universe with confidence and humor.
Admits his finals were a shambles and negotiates a deal with examiners with cleverness and self-awareness.
Jane gives Stephen her phone number discreetly; he is delighted and taps his foot.
Ignoring the challenging mathematical problems handed to him, continues reading a chess book and quietly leaves tutorial.
Stands forlorn but expresses delight upon receiving a phone number unexpectedly, showing momentary positive engagement.
Reads a chess book out of sight during a seminar when handed challenging mathematical problems, appearing to avoid the task and acknowledging being behind schedule.
Responds to Brian's teasing with light humor asking to play Wagner, despite Brian's refusal.
Denies doing any of the PhD questions and admits to procrastinating, showing honesty.
Does not engage in confrontation or hostility with Brian despite being called a liar.
Apologizes for being late and for clumsily spilling tea on his work; admits fault sincerely.
Arrives late to seminar and presents outdated train timetables, causing laughter, but responds with a simple apology without defensiveness.
Writes calculations rapidly and effortlessly, showing skill and intelligence.
Knocks over his cup of tea, ruining his only pad and then cannot find another to continue work.
Arrives late to the seminar.
Brings train timetables that are expired by a month to class, which are deemed totally unacceptable.
Encourages and motivates team as coxswain during rowing practice using energetic calls.
Admits limitation humorously ('I could only do nine') when others might expect more.
Fills timetables with tiny formulas and calculations, impressing Sciama and fellow students who are startled and speechless.
Acts confidently and skillfully as coxswain during a two-boat practice race, commanding the rowers with precise and energetic calls.
Bursts to provide the answer to the riddle, showing eagerness to engage with others.
Observes quietly, distracted while others engage rowdily, indicating reflective and possibly reserved behavior.
Smiles at the barman after a friendly exchange.
Smiles warmly upon receiving change from the barman, showing a dawning smile.
Approaches Jane confidently in front of a crowd, initiating conversation with friendliness and a smile.
Asks Jane to play croquet, showing interest in spending time with her.
Respectfully accepts Jane's refusal and does not press further, responding with an 'Oh. Of course.'
Turns and walks away after Jane declines the invitation, without any sign of bitterness or awkwardness.
Smiles dawning when receiving change, shows quick recovery from distraction.
Not afraid to stand in front of a crowd to get Jane's attention, confidently engages her in conversation.
Uses humor with 'my napkin just walked in' to deflect awkwardness.
Accepts Jane's polite rejection of croquet invititation gracefully and walks away without hesitation.
Plucks up courage and knocks on Sciama's office door despite uncertainty.
Stares silently at the fallen pen, appears hesitant to engage or share ideas.
Invites Jane to lunch at his family home, showing openness and inclusiveness.
Smiles wryly at Jane's question about church, showing humor and lightheartedness.
Expresses skepticism about religion but does so thoughtfully without dismissiveness.
Looks at the blank blackboard but puts chalk down and studies the ancient laboratory equipment with rapt awe.
Responds wryly and thoughtfully to Jane's question about religion, showing self-awareness and ability to reason through ideas.
Laughs along with family, smiles reassuringly at Jane when she looks nervous.
Playfully warns Jane not to touch the elderflower wine.
Responds sarcastically to Philippa's comment about church ('Positively saintly, thank you').
Explains his disbelief in God with rational explanation, not dismissive or confrontational.
Demonstrates quick wit and confidence in social setting by laughing at a joke and making a playful comment about the wine.
Explains his disbelief in God logically, stating that a physicist cannot allow calculations to be muddled by belief in a supernatural creator.
Engages in light-hearted punning game with family, displaying humor and playfulness.
Invites Jane to be his partner for the May Ball, showing thoughtfulness and inclusiveness.
Smiles, pleased with himself, showing confidence in his statement about physics and belief.
Participates skillfully and quickly in the family punning game with clever wordplay.
Responds humorously and creatively with puns on the spot, e.g., 'I'll wing it,' and 'Stop egging him on!'
Confidently invites Jane to be his partner for the May Ball, taking social initiative.
Invites Jane to be his partner for the May Ball confidently and with charm, and maintains a composed demeanor at the formal event.
Refuses to dance and firmly maintains this position despite Jane's subtle disappointment.
Explains the scientific reason behind the UV light glow to Jane in a soft and engaging manner, sharing knowledge and sparking her curiosity.
Observes Jane's happiness quietly and with captivation while riding the carousel, showing attentiveness and care.
Explains the scientific reason behind the glowing cuffs and shirt-fronts under UV light accurately and engagingly.
Connects his knowledge of fluorescence in washing powder with astrophysics (UV radiation from stars), demonstrating deep understanding and the ability to make imaginative scientific analogies.
Shares a lively and playful conversation with Jane, laughing and clinking glasses during a social event.
Engages attentively with Jane's interests and happily joins in on her enjoyment of the party atmosphere.
Engages in playful, intellectual banter about poetry and science, showing curiosity and knowledge.
Makes a lighthearted critical comment 'Ouch' about the poem, indicating confident evaluation.
Follows social cues well, sharing champagne and laughter, demonstrating social ease that supports competence.
Uses a warm metaphor to describe space and time as a married couple, bringing a sense of connection and harmony.
Looks moved by Jane’s serious quote, showing emotional sensitivity.
Asks Jane to dance, takes her hand, and kisses her tenderly on the bridge under the stars.
Does not run for the train with others but approaches calmly, putting on a brave face.
Arrives at the train platform on time despite difficulty, putting on a brave face and not running with others.
Shows visible relief during Roger Penrose's talk on black holes, indicating understanding and engagement.
Listens attentively and is captivated by complex scientific explanation of singularities and black holes.
Undergoes an epiphany, visualizing complex cosmic phenomena intuitively as a spiral galaxy in coffee cream, indicating deep insight.
Remains silent and deeply focused in group conversation, suggesting thoughtful reflection rather than disengagement.
Shares and excitedly expands on his new scientific idea to a delighted, smiling Jane while walking side by side.
Laughs and plays along as Jane grabs his hands and swirls him around, engaging warmly with her playful behavior.
Senses his protege is onto something and perhaps even smiles, indicating encouragement and support.
Smiles after explaining a complex idea, engages with his mentor encouraging further development.
Walks quickly and excitedly across campus, showing enthusiasm.
Falls and is immediately helped by students rushing to aid him.
Identifies and explains the concept of a spacetime singularity boldly and confidently at the blackboard.
Admits openly, 'I don't know how' to proceed further in developing the mathematics but continues working inspired nonetheless.
Writes, thinks, corrects, and rewrites formulas rapidly, showing perseverance and deep engagement despite physical weakening.
Trips and falls hard on campus due to his physical frailty.
Looks at the sick young man in the next bed who is gravely ill and is very moved when the young man dies.
Asks the doctor about his medical condition and listens carefully to the explanation despite the devastating news.
Struggles physically with simple movements and tests indicating early symptoms of his disease.
Passively observes the death and suffering around him, visibly moved but does not panic or lose composure.
Seeks to understand his diagnosis and clings to hope by asking about the brain and his thoughts despite devastating news.
Remains frozen and unreactive in public, seemingly withdrawn and overwhelmed by shock.
Initially reacts with shock, devastation, and freezes without response upon hearing the diagnosis.
Observes the fasciculation phenomenon on his arm with focused attention despite emotional shock.
Impassively shares the devastating diagnosis with Brian without dramatic outburst.
Does not try to lighten the mood or deflect Brian's joking despite the severity of the news.
Engages openly and frankly in conversation with Brian about his condition.
Recognizes and clearly states his diagnosis of motor neuron disease with calm acceptance.
Passively remains in his dorm room, in pajamas, seemingly withdrawn and quiet after receiving his diagnosis.
Stephen does his best to smile despite difficult news and the heavy emotional moment.
Stephen huddles against the door refusing to answer it, showing withdrawal and inability to confront the situation.
Responds to Jane with dry humor about a TV show plot, attempting to engage despite his depressed state.
Avoids looking at Jane and initially seems emotionally withdrawn and distant.
Allows Jane to approach and invites her to teach him croquet, showing openness to connection.
Cuts Jane off when she seeks reassurance, indicating emotional withdrawal or reluctance to engage fully.
Finally looks at Jane after silence, but rises angrily and walks off ahead of her.
Plays croquet aggressively and masterfully, not allowing Jane another shot, and smacks her ball down the lawn.
Walks off to his room after Jane shows emotion, unable to remain engaged or comfort her.
Plays a masterful game of croquet, skillfully manipulating the balls and finishing the game in a commanding manner.
Responds angrily to Jane's challenge, slams the door, and attempts to break a chair in frustration.
Angrily slams door, tells Jane to go away repeatedly, rejects emotional connection to focus on work.
Shows vulnerability when stunned by Jane's confession but does not reciprocate her emotion openly.
Expresses anger and frustration by slamming the door and trying to break a chair.
Decisively tells Jane to leave multiple times, showing clear prioritization of his work.
Shows emotional resistance and denial towards Jane's affection and support.
Acknowledges limited time and focuses on needing to work, indicating strong commitment and self-discipline.
Is stunned and unable to respond to Jane's declaration of love, showing a momentary emotional unpreparedness.
Allows Jane to care for him tenderly, emotionally responding positively to her affection and help.
Cuts off Sciama's tutorial abruptly with a single word, showing a brusque and dismissive manner.
Cuts off the tutor to assert his topic with confidence, stating 'Time' as his subject clearly and decisively.
Allows emotional vulnerability when moved by Jane's care, showing openness but not directly related to competence.
Delighted holding his one-year-old baby, showing joy and affection.
Laughs at himself sliding down the stairs, showing self-deprecating humor and lightheartedness.
Smiles gently and shakes his head when Jane offers to drive him, showing considerate but firm interaction.
Responds politely to examiners, thanks them sincerely after praise.
Declines offer to sit down, despite obvious difficulty.
Displays worry and tension visibly but maintains composure during critique.
Presents a thesis containing some weaknesses but ultimately recognized as brilliant with an extraordinary theory about a black hole at the beginning of Time, impressing an expert panel.
Waits silently and shows visible worry as the panel reviews his work, indicating awareness and concern over his competence but not losing composure.
Refuses to sit down when offered during the thesis defense, demonstrating confidence and resolve.
Smiles and engages in social gathering, shares moment with friends.
Drops his fork and shows visible frustration and sadness watching others easily socialize and move.
Rises and leaves party quietly when emotions overwhelm him, apologizing to others.
Demonstrates intellectual confidence by challenging to prove a fundamental scientific concept with a single elegant equation.
Displays physical limitations and frustration in social and physical settings, such as dropping a fork and struggling to walk, showing his vulnerability.
Reassures his two-year-old son Robert at the top of the stairs, saying 'It's okay Robert.'
Sheds private tears reflecting his despair while others are unaware.
Smiles, thanks Jane sincerely, shares a playful intimate moment with her.
Shows vulnerability and acceptance of his difficult situation (falling into wheelchair, recognizing it as temporary).
Encourages Jane to tend to the crying baby, showing trust and consideration.
Stares at the wheelchair with hesitation and ultimately falls into it, indicating initial difficulty accepting the aid.
Affirms that using the wheelchair is temporary, showing mental resilience and acceptance of his situation.
Smiles and adapts to having his bed set up in the dining room, makes lighthearted comments, and shows appreciation to Jane.
Attempts to put on his pyjama top by himself despite physical struggles, showing determination and effort.
Looks to Jane for reassurance in a moment of vulnerability, shows trust and awe towards her.
Nods in nervous agreement when encouraged by Sciama.
Returns a loving smile to Jane when she wishes him good luck.
Prepares to present groundbreaking ideas to peers despite visible nervousness and health challenges.
Exudes passion and confidence through his eyes, inspiring others despite difficult circumstances.
Jane hurries to gather Stephen's notes, water-bottle, blanket, and handbag to help him; Stephen continues his lecture despite slurring slightly.
Delivers a groundbreaking, complex scientific lecture uniting Relativity, Quantum Mechanics, and Thermodynamics despite skepticism; shows dedication and openness to new ideas.
Delivers a complex and groundbreaking lecture unifying Relativity, Quantum Mechanics, and Thermodynamics before skeptical peers.
Speaks with slight slurring due to his condition, but continues confidently to explain difficult scientific concepts.
Presents his theory calmly despite a lack of applause and guarded reaction from the audience.
Shuffles notes quietly without showing frustration or impatience when his theory is met with silence.
No direct interaction with others shown, no overt friendliness or warmth evident in this excerpt.
Responds to harsh criticism with a mild, self-deprecating question: 'Was it something I said?'
Allows himself to be swamped by well-wishers after his success, sharing the moment with others.
Presents a difficult theory publicly despite initial disbelief and hostility from peers.
Remains composed and responds with a subtle, confident remark ('Was it something I said?') after his theory is dismissed.
Receives public affirmation and validation from an esteemed external expert (Professor Khalatnikov) who praises his work.
Engages in light-hearted banter with Brian while being carried, calling him 'Big legs!'
Passively waits cradled in arms of a statue while Brian fetches wheelchair, showing trust and comfort in his friend.
Makes a witty, light-hearted comment 'Big legs! Big legs Brian!' while being carried up steps, showing presence of mind and humor despite physical limitations.
Explains to Brian that the motor neuron disease affects different systems and the automatic system remains functional, indicating clear understanding of his condition.
Sits patiently in his wheelchair watching Jane manage the heavy task of loading luggage and preparing the car amidst family chaos.
Does not assist physically with loading or preparations, limited by disability but remains quietly present.
Maintains composure and calm while others do the physical work of loading and traveling, acknowledging his physical limitations with quiet acceptance.
Sits passively in wheelchair, unable to help with loading or moving luggage, relying heavily on family’s physical efforts.
Allows Frank Hawking to feed him and silently endures difficult physical challenges without complaint.
No direct interactions showing friendliness or expressive warmth; mostly passive and dependent in this excerpt.
Remains composed and cooperative while others assist him with physical challenges such as getting into the car and being moved up steep steps in his wheelchair.
Suffers an uncontrollable choking fit, unable to manage or mitigate the situation himself.
Refuses to see doctors despite severe choking fit, insisting 'No doctors!'
Forcefully reassures family that 'We're fine--we're just a normal family' amid crisis
Acknowledges wife's anger with a smile, showing awareness and a gentle attempt to diffuse tension
Forcefully insists on no doctors despite severe choking fits, showing denial or avoidance of needed medical help.
Attempts to reassure family with a smile and light comment about being a normal family despite clear struggles.
Assesses the new electric wheelchair with some initial hesitation but adapts quickly to using it.
Demonstrates energetic and skillful control of the motorized wheelchair by chasing children at full speed, showing confidence and joy.
Motors confidently through Cambridge University corridors, commanding respect as others step aside.
Makes a playful bet with Sciama for a magazine subscription, jokes about winning even if wrong.
Grins and speeds toward the lift to be near two attractive undergraduate girls, smiling at them in the lift.
Bets against his own scientific belief with a humorous reasoning, demonstrating wit and confident self-awareness.
Accelerates his wheelchair at the last moment to catch the elevator, successfully navigating a risky maneuver that seems suicidal but works.
Remains cautious and silent while observing growing intimacy between Jane and Jonathan; gives a glare to Jonathan when he offers steak, making clear it is unwelcome.
Corrects Jonathan about his theorem, asserting knowledge of his PhD thesis and his new project disproving the previous theorem.
Shows cautiousness and alertness by sneaking glances and observing the growing intimacy between Jane and Jonathan.
Slurs his speech and is testy, making his communication less clear.
Responds sharply/corrects with 'No. Mine.' when Jonathan misunderstands his position, causing visible division between Jane and himself.
Maintains silence and does not react further during a tense moment (Jane spearing food with some annoyance visible).
States that belief is irrelevant in physics and challenges existing creation theories with a new project claiming the universe has no boundaries or beginning.
Responds sharply to Jonathan's misunderstanding of his work, correcting him confidently.
Does not engage in Jonathan's question about God dying, allowing Jane to explain instead.
Smiles appreciatively at Jane's explanation, showing engagement and a hint of warmth despite his condition.
Starts coughing but allows Jane to pat his back, indicating a level of trust and comfort with her caring gesture.
Smiles and positively affirms Jane's explanation by saying 'Very good.' indicating understanding and approval of complex scientific concepts.
Expresses a clear, succinct, and vivid summary of the challenge in unifying quantum theory and relativity by stating 'Tits up.'
Makes a witty comment about Einstein playing dice, smiles during the exchange.
Accepts Jonathan's help to sip his coffee quietly.
Makes a witty and insightful remark about Einstein and Quantum Theory, showing deep understanding and intellectual confidence.
Expresses belief that physics is 'back in business' and that understanding everything is the final challenge, indicating vision and confidence in his scientific competence.
Accepts help to sip coffee, showing vulnerability but also adaptability to his condition; does not diminish perceived competence.
Accepts help from Jonathan with drinking coffee.
Looks to Jane for reaction when Jonathan offers help; seems uncertain or hesitant.
Expresses understanding of need for more help and willingness to accept it if Jane continues to love him.
Watches Jonathan play piano without jealousy and with enjoyment.
Helplessly watches others playing, accepting care from Jonathan and appearing as friends.
Helplessly watches from his wheelchair as others play football, accepting care from Jonathan, appearing as friends.
Accepts help from Jane placing baby on his lap and participates in family events despite physical limitations.
Responds to father's insistence about live-in nurse with practical concerns about affordability, but without hostility.
Responds to concerns about care with clarity about current help but refuses a live-in nurse due to financial constraints, showing pragmatic self-awareness.
Uses humor/self-deprecation when Frank mentions his fame, distinguishing between scientific recognition and popular fame.
His slurred speech limits his ability to communicate effectively, indicating a physical limitation impacting competence in communication.
Observed JANE and JONATHAN's difficult conversation with concern from the window.
Considers how much Jane hates to fly; tries to find a way for her and the children to accompany him that minimizes her discomfort.
Includes and considers family logistics thoughtfully; suggests bringing the car and meeting later to ease burden.
Initiates a plan to attend an event in Geneva despite logistical challenges, suggesting ways for his family to meet him by car in Bayreuth, showing foresight and problem-solving.
Knows Jane's dislike of flying and tactfully negotiates travel arrangements respecting her feelings while pursuing his professional opportunity.
Persists in making plans despite Jane's visible distress and hesitation, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Allows carer Sarah to assist him promptly by holding a handkerchief when he coughs; does not resist help.
Passively endures severe health crisis without visible complaint or distress beyond physical symptoms.
Stephen maintains awareness and focus while listening to the Prelude of the Ring Cycle despite his health issues.
Stephen experiences a severe health crisis (coughing up blood) that leads to being stretchered out and intensive care, indicating physical vulnerability but not a lack of competence.
Stephen shows no evident incapacity in intellectual or decision-making aspects in this excerpt despite physical decline.
Endures critical illness passively, allowing others to make difficult decisions about his care without resistance or complaint.
Does not actively express emotions or engage verbally in intense medical moments, relying on advocates like Jane.
Panics upon waking from surgery and is soothed by a nurse.
Attempts to speak despite physical difficulty but fails to produce words.
Gloomily reads a newspaper using a reading frame, showing adaptation to physical limitations.
Swiftly turns his eyes away when caught looking at Elaine, showing social awareness and control.
Uses the E-Tran Board to communicate by evaluating and focusing on letter groups methodically.
Engages cooperatively with Elaine in communication using the eye-tracking board and grins appreciatively when she confirms his tea choice.
Demonstrates trust and mutual understanding in a friendly exchange with Elaine.
Successfully uses the color-coded board system to communicate complex information by memorizing the groups and blinking to select letters, leading to a breakthrough in communication.
Demonstrates confident and skillful non-verbal communication despite physical limitations, indicating intelligent adaptation and mastery of the system.
Sits patiently while the technician fits a new computer system; allows others to help and support him.
Uses an advanced communication device designed to compensate for his physical limitations, demonstrating adaptability to new technology and continuing his intellectual work.
Relies on specialized equipment and assistance to communicate, indicating dependence on others for practical functions.
Smiles after managing to use the new speech device, cheering himself up despite initial sadness and bleakness.
Is bewildered and startled by the American accent of his new voice device, showing vulnerability and sincerity in reaction.
Stares incredulously at Jane after hearing his synthetic voice, indicating a moment of honest, exposed emotion.
Plays and chases his son with a paper bag mask and mimics the Dalek war-cry, making his son squeal with joyous delight.
Communicates his ambition to write a book about time with a gentle moment shared with Jane and a smile exchanged.
Uses a voice-synthesizer to playfully chase his son around, showing engagement and adapting to his condition.
Decides to write a book about Time despite severe physical limitations, indicating determination and intellectual confidence.
Works persistently at night using limited motor skills (e.g., clicking a device with his palsied right hand) to produce text.
He smiles while pondering profound questions about time.
Urgently tries to stop Elaine from opening the Penthouse magazine addressed to his friend, indicating embarrassment and concern.
Responds honestly but awkwardly to Elaine explaining the magazine is for a friend.
Works in office at DAMTP, continues slow laborious work on his book despite difficulties.
Urgently types a voice message to stop Elaine from opening the Penthouse magazine but fails to prevent it.
Responds to potentially embarrassing situation calmly and honestly by admitting the magazine is for a friend.
Grins when Sciama exits blushing; smiles at Elaine, who senses his affection and laughs happily.
Works diligently and patiently on his writing alone, showing dedication but no interaction.
Continues to work alone, painstakingly writing one word at a time despite difficulties.
Pauses to ponder the title of his book, has an idea, and skillfully modifies the title to 'A Brief History of Time'.
Smiles and grins, showing confidence and charm in social interaction with Elaine.
Responds affirmatively and sincerely to Jane's question about belief in God, openly sharing a deep personal conviction.
Focuses intently on typing a message, showing engagement but limited social interaction in the moment.
Expresses a profound philosophical idea about the universe and the mind of God, indicating deep intellectual engagement.
Uses a communication device skillfully and confidently to express complex thoughts.
Maintains focused engagement on his work despite interpersonal interruptions and dynamics.
Uses his computer skillfully to communicate complex feelings and new information despite physical limitations.
Decides not to respond immediately when Jane confronts him, choosing instead to let her have her moment.
Maintains composure and a gentle demeanor while dealing with emotional and stressful news.
Nudges Jane's leg gently with his foot like a familiar pony, expressing comfort and closeness without words.
Says 'Be. Happy.' to Jane at a deeply emotional moment, showing care and tenderness.
Blinks once at Jane with tears in his eyes, communicating profound emotion sincerely.
His book 'A Brief History of Time' reaches number 1 on the bestseller list for 8 weeks.
Plays along with fans' request to sign his book by humorously offering to drive over it instead, causing laughter and positive response.
Interacts with fans and press confidently, uses humor to engage them instead of signing books.
Attempts to address the audience directly, shows vulnerability in wishing to speak with his own voice, and uses humor to downplay his physical challenges.
Motors onto the stage confidently to applause, indicating presence and engagement.
Attempts to respond verbally but struggles and ultimately uses his communication device to answer the audience question.
Answers the question about physical challenges with a witty, self-aware remark, showing intellectual control and emotional composure.
Responds to tourist humorously by saying he is not the real Stephen Hawking and the real one is better looking, making the tourist believe him and evoking laughter from the audience.
Jokes about giving a party for time travellers that no one attended, engaging playfully with the audience.
Notices a young lady’s pen cap fall and in spite of physical challenges makes an effort to pick it up, showing attentiveness and consideration for others.
Manages to painfully rise from his wheelchair and pick up the fallen cap, showing determination and physical effort despite difficulties.
Delivers a thoughtful, intelligent, and inspiring philosophical statement about life, the universe, and human spirit, captivating the audience.
Is forced back into his chair, unable to continue physical actions as he wishes, illustrating physical limitations but not intellectual capability.
Smiles upon seeing Elaine from his chair on stage.
Invites Jane and the children to accompany him.
Shares a tender moment with Jane; allows her to clean his glasses, showing comfort and connection.
Smiles upon seeing Elaine, showing emotional awareness and connection.
Surprised by the audience's positive reaction, indicating humility and openness to feedback.
Inviting children and family to accompany him, demonstrating thoughtful leadership and responsibility.
Engages tenderly and allows Jane to clean his glasses, showing self-awareness and willingness to accept help.
Watches his children play with fulfillment and deep satisfaction.
Smiles warmly at Jane and shares a moment of mutual affection.
Motors forward independently in his chair to watch his children, showing control and engagement despite physical limitations.
Uses his communication device skillfully to write a formal message accepting an honor, demonstrating intellectual ability and confidence.
Shares a tender look of love after Jane professes her love.
Interacts affectionately with his children, holding them on his lap.
Uses his communication device skillfully to construct meaningful sentences and express complex ideas, despite physical limitations.
Demonstrates emotional intelligence by sharing a tender, loving look with Jane, conveying deep personal connection even non-verbally.
Smiles at Jane when they first meet at the party.
Seeks a theory of everything at 72 years old and has no plans to retire.
Declines the offer of a knighthood from the Queen.
